channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: A pastebin with almost no user interface
item.description: Mike Doherty wrote WWW::Hashbang::Pastebin, a simple pastebin written in Dancer. I guess it could be nice to set it up within a company and start using it for showing code examples via the network.

item.title: Foswiki 1.1.5 released
item.description: Michael Daum announced the new release of the Perl based wiki. This includes both security fixes and other improvements.

item.title: Perlito version 9; Perl5 and Perl6 compilers
item.description: Flavio S. Glock released a new version of his awesome Perl compiler.

item.title: Nordic Perl Workshop 2012 - June 4-5 in Stockholm, Sweden
item.description: Claes Jakobsson finally announced the dates of the Nordic Perl Workshop!

item.title: EPO launch new membership and donations site
item.description: EPO = Enlightened Perl Organisation

item.title: Defending Against Its Dynamic Scope
item.description: chromatic writes about a nasty trap that one can fall in when using $_ in a construct that calls some other code that might change $_. It is especially a problem in map and grep where you have to use $_.

item.title: Breaking problems down and defaults
item.description: Zbigniew Lukasiak is trying to simplify the API of a module by adding wrappers and setting defaults.

item.title: Mojolicious Boilerplate Evolution
item.description: Tudor Constantin tells us the story behind the evolution of the Mojolicious Boilerplate. Some features that were added and lots of plans he has for the project.

item.title: Explaining Web Programming via Plack
item.description: Should Ovid introduce only PSGI in his book or should it also include Dancer and Catalyst?

item.title: Verifying MySQL behaviour with automated test suites and mytap
item.description: Cosimo Streppone did not write about Perl in this article but he is using mytap, the MySQL version of TAP, the Test Anything Protocol. It is very nice to see how Perl helps the quality of the Opera browser through testing MySQL.

item.title: Learning Perl with Testing
item.description: Instead of Test Driven Development, Nitish Bezzala suggests Test Driven Learning. I think this can be a good idea though one needs to think how to introduce it and how to make sure the test framework does not hide problems or introduces new ones.

item.title: Mock Objects Despoil Your Tests
item.description: While I agree with chromatic that too much mocking in tests is not healthy I am really not sure where does he get the idea that mocking is overused. The companies I visit never do mocking. OK, they usually don't do any testing and that's why they invite me and the only way to get some test up there is to mock half the universe. Or at least the external APIs. In any case, it would be interesting to check the level of mocking within CPAN.

item.title: Perl QA Hackathon
item.description: A late memoire from the Brazilian player called Breno G. de Oliveira (garu).

item.title: Can Parallel::ForkManager speed up a seemingly IO bound task?
item.description: An interesting exercise in benchmarking by Sinan �n�r.

item.title: Throwing and catching exceptions in Perl
item.description: Viacheslav Tykhanovskyi (vti) is a street performer juggling fire. He throws and catches exceptions without gloves. And without CPAN.

item.title: Perl - How to work offline?
item.description: Geistteufel sets up his environment to be able to work offline. Including having access to CPAN while on the road using Mini CPAN.

item.title: Simple HipChat notifier
item.description: Jason A. Crome provides a quick and dirty solution. Anyone there to make it more robust?

item.title: Learning Perl Challenge: tripwire
item.description: This week brian d foy asks you to monitor a directory to find any file changes.

item.title: use Perl; Poetry: Method to my $madness
item.description: In case you want to read a poem. In Perl. By Steve Bertrand.

item.title: Perl 6 Hackathon in Oslo: Be Prepared!
item.description: It is going to take place between 20-22 April 2012!

item.title: Plans for the Perl 6 Hackathon in Oslo
item.description: Tadeusz Sosnierz (tadzik) also has plans.

item.title: And now Lisbon too...
item.description: In addition to London, Oslo, and Zurich, Damian Conway will visit Lisbon too. Be prepared!

item.title: Perl Weekly reaches 3000 subscribers - two days later
item.description: This is a follow-up post

item.title: Perl Mova Workshop in Kiev
item.description: May 12-13, 2012, Kiev, Ukraine

item.title: Nordic Perl workshop
item.description: June 4-5, 2012, Stockholm, Sweden

item.title: YAPC::NA
item.description: June 13-15, 2012, Madison, Wisconsin, USA

item.title: French Perl workshop
item.description: June 29-30, 2012, Strasbourg
